solution.text:
Surface area of all the walls\(=2((Length \times Height) + (Breadth \times Height))\)
\(=2((_{j}_ \times _{l}_)+(_{k}_ \times _{l}_))\)
\(=2(_{{j*l}}_+_{{k*l}}_)=_{{2*(j*l+k*l)}}_sq.ft.\)
Area of window = \(_{m}_ \times _{n}_=_{{m*n}}_sq.ft.\)
Therefore, quantity of glass required \(=\) Area of wall \(-\) Area of window
\(=_{{2*(j*l+k*l)}}_-_{{m*n}}_\)
\(=_{{(2*(j*l+k*l))-(m*n)}}_sq.ft.\)

content.text: What quantity of glass(in sq.ft.) is required such that it is enough to cover all the walls except the window of size \(_{m}_\)ft \(\times _{n}_\)ft ?
